website_summaries.verdict: Sightseeing or delivering your big business presentation at the conference while wearing wrinkled clothing is a thing of the past with this small-size, big-performance folding travel iron.
pros: Full-range thermostat for multiple fabric types
Vertical steam capability so you can remove wrinkles from hanging garments
1000 watts of power and 200 microholes in the soleplate for easy ironing
Dual-voltage switch to iron just about anywhere in the world without need of adapters
cons: As with any travel iron, the power is lower than full-size models, and the water tank is small

customer_reviews.title: Read the manual and avoid breakage!
customer_reviews.text: Working just perfect as it should. I have found out that many of the bad reviews are due to a miss information regarding the functionality of the product... Just read the tiny manual that comes with the iron and you are going to love it If the handle leaks it has too much water. Everytime you try to fold the handle just remember it has a big purple "PUSH" labelled button on the bottom to allow the folding action. Otherwise indeed it's going to break. Enjoy your new mini iron.
customer_reviews.author: Marisol P.

customer_reviews.title: Great Iron for Sewing and Quilting
customer_reviews.text: I needed a smaller iron to keep downstairs where I sew and first bought a tiny one that is hard to grasp with my arthritic fingers. Then I dropped it the first day and broke off one of the little legs that allow it to stand. I did more research and came across this Rowenta Travel-Ready iron, which folds up and comes with a travel pouch. It's perfect for the small seams I sew when I quilt and its narrow profile is great for getting into corners. I like it so much better than the larger iron in my laundry room, I might just use it for all ironing from now on.
customer_reviews.author: KTraxTop Contributor: Fashion Design

customer_reviews.title: Works great, dies young!
customer_reviews.text: This iron works great! It's a very handy size too. It packs up compactly and has its own little zipper case. Unfortunately, this is the second one I've had and neither one lasts more than a few years. At a certain point it just stops heating up! And I follow all the care instructions including emptying out the water reservoir between uses (or at the end of a day of sewing). I'm so disappointed, and I won't be getting a 3rd, because even though irons never last that long, I expect them to last longer than 2 years.
customer_reviews.author: Baby Boomer

customer_reviews.title: A little gem.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this iron as it was highly recommended by Sharon Schamber for a class of hers I recently attended. She recommended it by brand name and model as the only one she has found that gets hot enough to work well with the appliqué technique she taught us. It is very easy to use. It is small and light so it is easy to take to class, and to use on large and small pieces of fabric. Just a gem.
customer_reviews.author: Jane A

customer_reviews.title: Handle broke just days after the Warranty period.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this iron almost exactly one year ago. Ten days past the one year warranty the handle broke as I was ironing and it is now unusable. I don't see any way to fix it. It was a wonderful product until just now though. It heated up fast and was as good as a full size iron. Have not decided if I will send it in for repair as the postage and repair costs will probably be as expensive as a new iron. I will not be buying another one as I can't trust that it would not happen again.
customer_reviews.author: Diane Zimanski

customer_reviews.title: No vertical steam
customer_reviews.text: I bought this one specifically because of the vertical steam feature. The iron heated up well, I filled it, but the steam sputtered and shut off completely when I held it vertically while pushing the burst of steam button. I fiddled for quite a while, assuming I was doing something wrong, but even after triple checking the instructions - no vertical steam. Even the steam produced at the normal position did not come out evenly, so I asked to return it. Have to say the vendor was very helpful and gave me a refund right away.
customer_reviews.author: Busia

customer_reviews.title: unable to turn this iron off
customer_reviews.text: per enclosed instruction manual, the diagram of iron shows an on/off switch. where the on/off switch is shown in manual, this item has a dry/steam switch. there is not an on/off switch, nor does the dial rotate to an off position. manual 'important safety instructions' notes to always make sure iron is in the off position prior to plugging in and in the off position before unplugging. other than not being able to turn iron off, love the size and easiness to use, nice and compact. but do I really want an iron than can not be turned off manually????? will contact rowenta/amazon
customer_reviews.author: pra4america

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Waste Your Money
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews for this travel iron carefully. Only a few customers mentioned that this iron does not heat, and does not steam. Because the majority of the statements were positive, I purchased it to take on vacation and was very disappointed when out if the box, it would not heat up nir oroduce steam. I own a very good Rowenta iron and have used it for many years without problem. Although the company used to be a product line that you could depend on, it isn't as reliable now. Save yourself the headache, do not purchase this product.
customer_reviews.author: PDG

customer_reviews.title: Great...’til it’s not
customer_reviews.text: I ONLY use this iron for hand applique work...maybe twice a year. This is my second one. I love the handle and pointy tip...something my other two mini irons (Oliso mini and Reliable mini) lack. But sadly...yet another has just stopped working. So if you need this for travel...there’s more Reliable irons on the market, with better steam options. But if you use this for sewing, better have a good iron as your every day iron and only buy this one if you need the pointy tip and understand, it will need to be replaced soon after purchase.
customer_reviews.author: RobinDTop Contributor: Sewing

customer_reviews.title: Don't expect a long life for the iron
customer_reviews.text: I just bought a replacement for an identical model and manufacturer of this iron. I used the iron for about two years while traveling. Occasionally the iron would not produce stream and all it took was a bit of shaking for whatever clogged the steam lines to allow steam to come from the face of the iron. The exact same model I had was fine which is why I bought another when the other identical iron died. If you factor in the convenience and money saved for ironing while traveling, the iron is well worth the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Traveler2014

customer_reviews.title: A Neat Little Package
customer_reviews.text: I bought this little iron to take with me to touch up dress shirts and pants after long stays in a suitcase. I used it last month in Tanzania and it met my criteria. One note, especially to men, read the instructions about raising and lowering the handle. In order for the iron to be compact, the handle folds down over the body of the iron. There is a button near the bottom of the handle that must be pushed in order to move it. My first inclination was to try harder-then HARDER. That's the manly thing to do if you want to ruin the iron. It takes little pressure to push the button and it works fine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: heats very fast
customer_reviews.text: this little iron is great! it heats very fast and it is very hot, easy to move around., lots of steam. only draw back is the water reservoir is in the handle so it is small so you need to refill it often. unless you remember to switch it to no steam. i love how it will switch from steam to no steam almost instantly. thanks for the very quick delivery also.
customer_reviews.author: Isabel

customer_reviews.title: If you travel, you need this in your suitcase.
customer_reviews.text: We’ve had two older model Rowenta steamers over the past 25-ish years. Ultimately they give up producing steam or whatever. Nothing lasts forever and we’ve had good service with these and also a workhorse Rowenta steam iron. This new version is a +gem+. It’s half the size and weight of the earlier versions, plus it’s a travel iron in addition to being a steamer. This baby puts out some major steam and powers away any wrinkles in cotton shirts and wool suits, FAST. You need this steamer/iron if you travel and your clothes get at all wrinkled in a suitcase. Buy it!
customer_reviews.author: Motorcycle Fanatic

customer_reviews.title: This small iron packs a punch!
customer_reviews.text: I love this small iron. It is powerful (1000 watts), maneuvers like a dream, provides a lot of steam power and has two voltage selections depending upon your needs. This is one great iron. I am so happy with my purchase and I highly recommend the Rowenta brand (I have had a larger Rowenta iron for years and love it) as they are wonderful to iron with.
customer_reviews.author: D. Bicjan

customer_reviews.title: You can’t go wrong with Rowenta
customer_reviews.text: I have owned Rowenta irons for the better part of ten years and you really can’t go wrong with a Rowenta. This travel iron is no exception . The only negative I see with it is that unlike your normal size irons, this iron does not have a little light showing you that it is on, and it takes a little while to cool off so I would not recommend ironing right before you have to pack up. Other than that, I have no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love this iron!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a smaller iron to use while quilting. I wanted to have one to sit next to my sewing machine so that I didn't have to get up and walk across the room to set seams, etc. when piecing a quilt top. I saw this one used on Fons & Porter's quilting program and thought if it's good enough Sara Gallegos, then it's good enough for me. (LOL) It is perfect for a small sewing station and to travel to quilting sessions with a friend. I am truly happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Jacobsen

customer_reviews.title: Not hot enough temps for quilters!
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed in this iron.. I am a quilter and even on the hottest setting, it does not get hot enough to press seams flat. Handle is comfortable and cord is long enough... but it's not nearly as good as the Sunbeam Hot 2 trot Travel iron for temperature needed for quilting..
customer_reviews.author: CarlaT

customer_reviews.title: Great little iron for piecing and travel quilting.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this little iron for quilt piecing and traveling. I love the pointy end accuracy, many steam holes, and reliability. My sewing area is limitrd and it fits really well on my mini ironing table next to my sewing machine, so I can piece and iron my quilt blocks with having to go into another room. I bought this small iron for the features mentioned above and because of my good experience with my full size Rowenta iron.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pay attention to why an item has been returned and DO NOT reshelve if it was not functioning!
customer_reviews.text: I love this little iron BUT!! I had purchased to replace an identical one that died and when the new one came it was apparent that it had been a return and the steam function on the new one DID NOT WORK! Why in the world would you reshelve a nonfunctioning item? Come on Amazon, if someone returns an item and reports it as defective don't put the next purchaser (Me!) through this frustration!
customer_reviews.author: Donna Aybar

customer_reviews.title: Great for sewing room, college, RV or travel
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my sewing room where my work table is a bit cramped and this is much easier to use in a tight space than my full sized iron. The iron heats up very quickly, produces a ton of steam when needed and folds down to a convenient size for travel. It is lightweight, but strong; of course follow the instructions and don't force the handle down, rather push in the button and it will fold easily. Treat this iron as it was designed to be used and it should last years. I would highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: F Jacob

customer_reviews.title: great iron
customer_reviews.text: I have owned 2 of these irons one I had so long I wore it out and the last one I dropped. They are easy to use because they are mini and fit on my ironing table perfect . I quilt and never had a problem. I tried to get another one because I liked it so much but couldn't find it. When I saw it on Amazon I was thrilled and ordered right away. I hope it will be just as good as my last 2. Thank you Amazon for having my favorite iron.
customer_reviews.author: carol rose

customer_reviews.title: Great iron to take to classes and quilt retreats
customer_reviews.text: This the second one of these irons I have purchased. First one I got was about 7 years ago and I used it for classes and right by my sewing machine. The handle broke finally making it unusable, so I ordered a new one. It is a good iron.
customer_reviews.author: Polly

customer_reviews.title: Great small iron
customer_reviews.text: I'm so glad I waited and ordered this iron instead of some of the smaller mini irons that are not hot enough. It heats up fast and stays hot, has a long cord. I keep it right next to my sewing machine table on a smaller rolling cart with a wool pressing mat. It's so easy that I don't have to get up every time I sew a block. It also has capability for steam. Best little iron for quilting. Thanks Jodi Barrows from Square in a Square as she uses this iron.
customer_reviews.author: KABrown

customer_reviews.title: This is a wonderful travel iron!
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure how anyone can say a bad thing about this iron. It's great. The only thing I can think of is that people who give this iron a bad review did not read the instructions. If you time a few minutes to READ THE INSTRUCTIONS so that you know how to operate this iron, it won't give you any problems and will perform flawlessly. I've been using this iron for about a week now while I'm on the road and it's been nothing short of perfection. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: E. Siegel

customer_reviews.title: Not What I Expected
customer_reviews.text: This iron is a disappointment to me. I was under the impression that it was supposed to produce continuous steam not just when I press the steam button. It does not seem to get very hot and I find myself having to iron and re-iron fabric to get rid of the wrinkles. I reached out to the Rowenta people via email asking for assistance and have not heard back at all. I have used $10.00 irons that only lasted a year that were better than this one. I expected better from Rowenta.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia

customer_reviews.title: A wolf in sheep’s clothing....
customer_reviews.text: Great little iron...until it died. Had it for 15 months, used it from time to time over the year when I was quilting, it wasn’t my primary iron, so I expected it to last. Well, it didn’t. Was working just fine today and then bam....no steam....no heat. Really a big disappointment. A good friend who bought hers a week before in bought mine, well, guess what? Hers died last week. Is it made with a 15 month self-destruct sensor? I thought buying a Rowenta was a plus. Not so much. Not buying it again,
customer_reviews.author: jay

customer_reviews.title: STEAM DOESN'T WORK WELL
customer_reviews.text: I have a full size Rowenta iron, but wanted the smaller one for sewing and mask making. The steam worked for one day - the second day it did not. I did everything in the instructions, waited for the iron to heat, put in right amount of water, etc. It's going back.
customer_reviews.author: Elaine H.

customer_reviews.title: Works great and very convenient
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to try Rowenta for a long time. Nervous though about reviews about the handle. I have had it a couple weeks and I love it. It heats quickly, and i can keep it right next to my sewing machine. I have not used the steam function and I have been careful with the handle.
customer_reviews.author: tgilliam

customer_reviews.title: I loved this iron for 5 months
customer_reviews.text: I loved this iron for 5 months, got hot fast, worked great...after 5 months, steam stopped working and the handle broke, so I am contacting the manufacturer and see what they will do.
customer_reviews.author: Dwayne Stroman

customer_reviews.title: Petite and powerful
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice sized petite iron. It has a comfortable handle and it gets super hot super fast. The only negatives so far that i have are as follows - i do not care for the location of the cord it looks like its soft and can swivel easily but its just a bit clunky for my taste. Im sure that on a regular sized iron it really wouldn't be an issue - the other thing i dont care for is there is no automatic shut off. All my other Rowena's have had that feature so now im a bit tripped up in having to remember to unplug that bad boy. Its a very good iron so far
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Stigen

customer_reviews.title: Bought new received  a disappointing used item
customer_reviews.text: I ordered on 07/31/2020 it arrived 08/01/2020..I immediately knew this item was used after opening the brown shippinf not to find the iron just sitting inside the box in a plastic bag.. The warranty card was complete from a customer who show purchase data 06/29/2020...this is just plain disrespectful... I believed to have been purchasing a brand new in box item... when I used the item the steam button functionals as if it’s on the dry setting, no steam at all coming out. I have a full size Rowenta and love it but this one has fallen short...I will be returning and seeing if Amazon will so better on next purchase
customer_reviews.author: Elise

customer_reviews.title: Do not hesitate to buy this travel iron
customer_reviews.text: I always buy Rowenta irons for home and travel, as I iron all of my clothes. This is my second Rowenta travel iron. My previous one lasted for many years. I just returned from traveling with the new one, and it worked great. I also recommend purchasing a foldable insulated ironing mat so that you can iron safely anywhere while traveling.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Handle
customer_reviews.text: I like it’s size and am an avid quilter so use it constantly while I am piecing right next to my machine. I have just purchased my fourth one! The handle always breaks on it w/o fail but I have never found one I like better so I continue to buy them, break them and replace them. My first one lasted years and since then I probably get a couple years out of them and then the handle breaks and it’s virtually useless then.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy K.

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and smooth
customer_reviews.text: I love this portable iron. It irons very smooth and easy. I use it for my quilting. The only problem is the after about aprox 6 months the steam option stopped working. I have to use the burst of steam in order to steam iron.
customer_reviews.author: Susan B.

customer_reviews.title: Sputters, Doesn't Steam
customer_reviews.text: Apparently I've had this in the box for 8+ years so it's out of warranty but it should work. It was never opened. It never steams at all - just sputters and spits water all over. It doesn't matter how high it's filled either. I suppose I can use it as a dry iron but that's a shame. I dragged out the big T-Fal which is much older and used it instead.
customer_reviews.author: Diana Mc

customer_reviews.title: Loved to use the iron for quilting...folding handle failed at 18 months
customer_reviews.text: I loved the amount of steam and the light weight of this product, so much so that I used it for all my ironing - and I do a lot as I'm a quilter. That said, after 18 months the handle would not remain open and with it folded, you can't iron. As the warranty was 1 year, I'm out $27...
customer_reviews.author: Eileen

customer_reviews.title: Breaks easily
customer_reviews.text: Love the size of this little iron and the steam is great. However, the handle breaks quite easily. This is the second one I have bought...handle broke on the first one to, but thought it might have been faulty so tried a second one. Same problem. I have jerry rigged it so that I can still use it because I love it otherwise, just wish that the handle was sturdier or a different design.
customer_reviews.author: Heart4Nrsg

customer_reviews.title: Best little iron out there
customer_reviews.text: It has a nice long cord, which you need for traveling, since you never know where the outlet will be. It's very compact and provides lots of steam. Works great! Just remember to push the "Push" button to put the handle down
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Unexpectedly unacceptable product
customer_reviews.text: After six months this iron stopped working. Altogether. Rowenta customer service rep had no good answers for me. An iron carrying this name should be more reliable, and when something goes wrong, the customer service department should be more knowledgeable. An entirely unsatisfactory experience.
customer_reviews.author: gamma2all

customer_reviews.title: Lasts Until The Handle Collapses
customer_reviews.text: I am a quilter so this lightweight iron gets a lot of use. However plan on about one year before the handle completely collapses during use! This has happened to every Rowenta I have bought. I still keep buying them but maybe I will find an iron as easy to use but lasts longer!!
customer_reviews.author: TATA

customer_reviews.title: Heats up fast...great light weight iron for those small jobs.
customer_reviews.text: If you use this for light pressing and also are using a light touch it's perfect. The handle is not that sturdy if you are heavy handed. I really never used the stem. I use it next to me when I sew & quilt and need to iron out the pieces and it works great for that. Heats up fast, has a nice long cord and great for quick jiffy things you need pressed. It has a AC/DC switch if you go out of the country, but when I do I don't bother with taking an iron....too many great travel fabrics now.
customer_reviews.author: C. P. Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: Big disappointment.
customer_reviews.text: The temperature dial is not in a convenient location and is too tight so it is difficult to turn. It holds a tiny amount of water so runs out very quickly. I use it for pressing while sewing/quilting. I would not buy it again. I liked my little Sunbeam portable iron much better.
customer_reviews.author: Dr Deb

customer_reviews.title: Rowenta DA1560- terrible iron
customer_reviews.text: I bought this model iron - Rowenta DA1560 3 times-they got hot, but NONE of them steamed horizontally. I called Rowenta, they were no help, they suggested I buy one from another retailer, saying Amazon or Joann Fabrics may have not had the newest model -- that is ridiculous - right out the box it didn't work. This model is made in China, it could be part of the reason. Some of the bigger Rowenta's are made in Germany still. I have been quilting 20 yrs, always loved Rowentas, but quality has gone down immensely.
customer_reviews.author: Barb M

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I love this iron! I use it for quilting & sewing. I don't put water in it & I don't put a lot of pressure down on the handle, I don't need to, it gets plenty hot for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Carol

customer_reviews.title: Iron small for travel to sewing class
customer_reviews.text: I think I never be happy with a small travel iron because I want it to deliver fast hot heat and it can't compete with a regular iron. It did leak but I over filled it. It takes a bit to heat up.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Coppola

customer_reviews.title: Hot enough for applique, perfect travel size.
customer_reviews.text: I love this iron. This is my second one. The first lasted 6 1/2 years with heavy continuous use. It works better for me with freezer paper applique - because it is hotter than other small irons - and it's just overall a great little iron. Only thing I wish is that it cooled down a bit faster, but I've learned to work around that when leaving a quilt retreat. Awesome iron!!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: No off switch!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love this little iron, and I do except....first of all, it came without a users manual. I couldn’t find out how to turn it off. Apparently there’s no way to turn it off except to unplug it. I’m 82 years old. I’m not going to bend over and unplug it every time. How hard would it have been to put an off switch on it, or at least auto off. I have loved Rowenta irons for years. But I’m very disappointed this time. It’s a deal breaker for me!!
customer_reviews.author: Judy G.

customer_reviews.title: Rowenta Used to be the Best!
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately this iron only last 10 months. The tiny plastic button that you push to use steam doesn't work any longer so you cannot use steam. Really disappointed as I have always relied on Rowenta for my home quilting and pressing needs.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia McGuinn

customer_reviews.title: Handle Latch Broke while Ironing
customer_reviews.text: Loved the size and weight of this iron for quilting and ironing small pieces. I have read other reviews about the push button at the bottom, but I was no trying to fold the handle down, just ironing when it broke. Now the handle does not latch making it almost useless. Only lasted 1.5 years. Ridiculous to have to replace already.
customer_reviews.author: Martha

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Travel Iron
customer_reviews.text: Excellent for travel or any time! Use the steam option for steaming clothes, drapes, anything that needs steaming. I use for quilting needs. Precise, totally flat pressing on or off steam option. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Jolene G Bethke

customer_reviews.title: Prefect in taking to quilting classes and groups.
customer_reviews.text: As a Quilter and gadget lover.. This travel iron is permanently on my iron board. The handle and stability of the iron is extremely important. No tipping !! No burning my arm!! Crisp pressing .. Tried so many mini irons this product is far more superior ..
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Brand. Impressed with it's size & ability to ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent Brand. Impressed with it's size & ability to collapse for travel. Got it for quilt retreats away from home. My friend has one which I borrowed for a short while. & it was just what I needed. Also got it for a very good price during Amazon Prime Day.
customer_reviews.author: Louise in Oregon

customer_reviews.title: very handy and steam too!!
customer_reviews.text: I recently attended a quilt retreat where someone was using this handy little iron. They let me use it too, and what a great iron! It even has steam! It worked great and I went right home and ordered one for myself! I love it. No problems here. I keep this right next to me when I'm paper piecing, so as not to be constantly getting up and down to press each seam. This, along with my handy little pressing board, has simplified the entire process. I couldn't be happier with this super product!
customer_reviews.author: widowgirl

customer_reviews.title: Great size for young sewers
customer_reviews.text: I bought this a year ago so my 8 year old granddaughter could press her own quilt pieces and she loves it. I find it very convenient for quickly pressing small pieces beside my machine. I've read other reviews about the handle failing which I can't speak to, I just leave it open and ready to use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Handle breaks easily - yet a great size
customer_reviews.text: Works great as I am a quilter and use it on a wool pad also. Have owned it 18 months. I love the fact it has a stainless steel plate. Handle busted last month which I am not a happy camper. The iron also takes a long time to cool down after unplugged. Needs handle improvement quickly as it is not helping the Rowenta brand name.
customer_reviews.author: Night Hawk Team

customer_reviews.title: I was never satisfied with the heat as it did not seem to ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this iron for quilting use. I was never satisfied with the heat as it did not seem to heat as hot as my larger iron and the heat did not stay consistent. After approximately a year of use, the handle broke. If you purchase this iron, do not expect to be able to apply any pressure at all to the handle. It was great for travelling to quilt retreats, but I now need a new one. I certainly don't think this iron is worth the extra bucks for the name brand!
customer_reviews.author: Schroyer

customer_reviews.title: Great little iron
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for a cruise vacation and it performed well. Steam surprisingly good but does not burst steam, just when ironing. Happy with the travel iron.
customer_reviews.author: Robert M

customer_reviews.title: Great little iron
customer_reviews.text: When you don't want to drag your projects to the big ironing board, this small iron packs a punch and gets the job done. I set up right next to my sewing machine. Love it
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca B.

customer_reviews.title: Steam didn't work right out of box.
customer_reviews.text: Aarrrrgghhhh.... Brand new right out of the box and the steam doesn't work!!! Sadly returning.
customer_reviews.author: pangest

customer_reviews.title: ROWENTA TRAVEL IRON
customer_reviews.text: I just had to replace this iron after 20 years. Im a quilter and use this at all the retreats, when Im sewing applique projects and just about for everything, unless you have yardage to iron. Great product and lasted forever!
customer_reviews.author: cr51103

customer_reviews.title: Gets very hot!
customer_reviews.text: I use this iron for pressing my quilt pieces. My only problem with this iron is it gets so hot I can barely turn the control knob. It's so very HOT!
customer_reviews.author: Pokey

customer_reviews.title: Sewing
customer_reviews.text: We have a standard Rowneta iron and I bought this to do some sewing projects. I use it more for sewing than my big iron
customer_reviews.author: Lue Clark

customer_reviews.title: Better Than Any other.....
customer_reviews.text: Just love this little iron for my quilting - it heats up really fast and you can use steam or no steam - super sweet little iron. As I age - I don't like the big heavy irons that I used to thoroughly enjoy....this will be awesome even for travel, but it's the BEST for my quilting. LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.author: Kelly J.

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommend
customer_reviews.text: I love the fold up portability and how easy this is to use. It fits in my hand great and heats up quickly and accurately. It gets hot enough to do the job for such a little iron. I use it instead of my bigger iron when I don't want to burn my fingers :)
customer_reviews.author: Cherie

customer_reviews.title: Light and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I mostly use this iron when I go to a quilting retreat. And it is very convenient to use.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn Holmes

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for tiny details.
customer_reviews.text: Love love love. I use to iron doll clothes. Steam works great. Read directions and handle will work fine. Comes with travel bag.
customer_reviews.author: S. Sasser

customer_reviews.title: Leak
customer_reviews.text: It leaked at the first time use. I think it is because I pressed the steam button when it was not in the steam function. The steam button is not very comfortable, and it might not be durable.
customer_reviews.author: Han

customer_reviews.title: Almost like a full-size iron
customer_reviews.text: I’m using this travel iron next to my sewing machine to press quilt seams. It gets nice and hot, is easy to use, and heats up quickly. The cord is a nice length.
customer_reviews.author: Roberta

customer_reviews.title: Best iron ever...
customer_reviews.text: This mini iron is new baby. I love, love, love this stream iron.❤️
customer_reviews.author: Jodie

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: It doesn’t work as well as I had hoped. Would purchase a different one if I had the choice.
customer_reviews.author: Karen B.

customer_reviews.title: ... owned Rowenta irons in the past and been very happy until recently
customer_reviews.text: I have owned Rowenta irons in the past and been very happy until recently. I purchased two of these travel irons, one for myself and one as a gift to my sister. Unfortunately my sister's overheated and started smoking and burning at a quilting retreat. I have stopped using mine because I have since learned of two other quilters who had the same experience with this iron catching fire or starting to burn while in use. The product cannot be returned now, but I would caution others against purchasing this iron until the company fixes this issue.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: not worth it
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these irons years ago and used it intermittently for years. Had problems with the steam not always working and then my cat knocked it on the ground and the fold-out handle would no longer lock in place. I bought a new one. After only one month, it began to crackle and pop and emit black smoke. scary. I think this iron is dangerous and do NOT recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Tonya R.

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t steam at all!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this iron in October of 2019, heats up very good but after a few times of uses it stop steaming, it doesn’t leaks, just don’t steam and brought it for small sewing projects that needs a lot of pressing. A little disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Ms. A

customer_reviews.title: Needs exchange or repair
customer_reviews.text: Where can I bring my iron for service? I used it 4/5 times and the handle collapsed suddenly while ironing, needless to say, I hurt my fingers badly. I can’ t use this iron because of safety issue. I appreciate in advance your help in this matter. Thank you Noella Maria
customer_reviews.author: Noella M.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Rowenta irons have always been my choice of irons but this travel iron is disappointing. I bought it for sewing but it does not get hot enough to use. Sorry, thumbs down.
customer_reviews.author: Connie S. Rice

customer_reviews.title: The Size
customer_reviews.text: Easy to store, heats and steams really good. I'll use for press sewing projects, quilt blocks. Good price! Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: myree williams

customer_reviews.title: Rowenta Iron
customer_reviews.text: I bought this iron to take to Quilting classes and retreats. I use a compact portable ironing board, cutting board combination (a happy purchase also from Amazon), and the small iron fits perfectly. The reason I chose this iron was the high praise it got from other quilter participants. It has a lot of steam when you need it or can be used dry, with settings in between. I hope it has a nice long life and would buy this particular iron again. The handle collapses when finished, and it fits in a nice zippered travel bag. The only thing I would wish for is a "stay on" setting.
customer_reviews.author: K.Joy Richards

customer_reviews.title: Super
customer_reviews.text: Great purchase. Works well for me. Super light weight and great for quilting.
customer_reviews.author: Amy L Keller

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size
customer_reviews.text: But, does not live up to the Rowenta name, or maybe all their products are that way. Within 6 months of purchase (I nave purchased 4) they start leaking water and steam does not work. It is the perfect size for travel on quilting retreats, but does not work! Contacted Rowenta with no reply! For the price of the iron it should work like a charm. My $13 rival works without fail just not small enough for travel, but I take it anyway because it is dependable.
customer_reviews.author: Evelyn Golden

customer_reviews.title: Quit working!!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second rowenta DA1560 that I have owned! They both quit heating! I just threw my last one away last week because it quit heating. I had it less than 18 months. Just over the warranty period!! I had probably used it a dozen times. Beware!
customer_reviews.author: Linda Shelton

customer_reviews.title: so good. The only drawback for me is that the ...
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. The only drawback for me is that the temperature setting dial is a bit sticky.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer D.

customer_reviews.title: Steam stopped working after a few uses
customer_reviews.text: I love the design and portability of this iron, but the steam stopped working after A dozen or so uses. Otherwise, it has been a great product that is easy to pack for a business trip.
customer_reviews.author: flydeltajets

customer_reviews.title: Great little iron
customer_reviews.text: This brand is amazing, great traveling iron, unfortunately the delivery was not as promise, it said next day but it arrived 3 days later, almost miss the day of my trip.
customer_reviews.author: ernest

customer_reviews.title: Great Lil Travler
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a two week trip up north in 2010 still use in now in 2014. Very well made product, I also keep it in my car in case I need it at work. Gets hot really fast, so be careful not to keep it low near kids or pets. It will s*** off if your not using it for a while in between ironing sessions. I am an iron geek, I even do my jeans, I know that's weird. Pros Gets Very Hot Adjustable Settings Steamy Easy to Travel With Cons None Overall excellent little iron for on the go people.
customer_reviews.author: josh

customer_reviews.title: Great for quilting.
customer_reviews.text: I use this iron for my quilting work. Love the size. Don’t know yet about durability as I just got it.
customer_reviews.author: Lola m.

customer_reviews.title: Broken handle after few weeks
customer_reviews.text: Great little iron. Heats fast and handle very well. Except that the handle broke after few weeks. So total waste of money. Just get something that will last instead.
customer_reviews.author: Kmuriel

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working right after 5 months
customer_reviews.text: This iron only lasted 5 months and after 3 months the steam quit working ... disappointed! The sad thing is when we first got this iron it worked wonderful and I was happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Sandee

customer_reviews.title: Broken handle but good iron
customer_reviews.text: This is a great iron BUT the handle broke after about a month of using it. Hurts my fingers when the handle comes down on them.
customer_reviews.author: Pam Madrid

customer_reviews.title: Iron quit after 1 month
customer_reviews.text: The iron stopped working after 1 month, 2 days after it could be returned. The packaging and also the iron have a horrendous smell like someone spilt a stinky oil or perfume all over the box and also the iron. I had to throw away all of the packaging, literature.
customer_reviews.author: Sasha

customer_reviews.title: Size vs performance
customer_reviews.text: I love the size of ‘this next my machine for pressing as I go. I highly recommend this product
customer_reviews.author: Leilani Abbott

customer_reviews.title: This little iron works well while traveling. It gets ...
customer_reviews.text: This little iron works well while traveling. It gets the wrinkles out without too many passes as long as its hot with a little steam. I would order it again.
customer_reviews.author: Smoothe13

customer_reviews.title: My travel iron for quilt retreats!
customer_reviews.text: It is all that it is advertised to be!! Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Carol G. Nye

customer_reviews.title: Almost caught fire!
customer_reviews.text: This iron worked great for almost 2 months during which time I used it lightly every other weekend. Last week I was ironing with it when it started making crackling sounds. I thought it was the steam until smoke started rising out from between the metal plate and the plastic base. I quickly unplugged it and through it in the kitchen sink to douse it with water. Afterwards my entire apartment smelled like burned plastic and if I hadn't been there attending to it as this happened I hate to think of what could have happened! This item is a safety hazard!
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Baron

customer_reviews.title: Fits in luggage with ease.  Built in converter for travel.Received on time.
customer_reviews.text: Fits in luggage with ease. Built in converter for travel.Received on time.
customer_reviews.author: N M Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great Iron
customer_reviews.text: Love this iron! Unfortunately, I dropped my first one that I had used for years. Couldn’t wait to replace it! Great iron for Quilters!
customer_reviews.author: Kbr47

customer_reviews.title: reliable iron
customer_reviews.text: This travel iron gets nice and hot and has great steam.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen

customer_reviews.title: awesome for travel
customer_reviews.text: This is pretty quick to heat up fully, and is lightweight enough to toss in your carry-on. So handy! So convenient! However, I am getting a heavier, bigger iron to use more regularly at home -- this little one is not heavy enough or big enough to use if you're going to do a lot of ironing. Unless you get sore muscles easily, in which case, get this one!
customer_reviews.author: Veronica

customer_reviews.title: What has happened to Rowenta?
customer_reviews.text: I have had many Rowenta irons over the years. I bought this one to take to quilting classes to replace one I had for years. It takes a long time to heat. You have to push the button to get it to steam. Very disappointed. I waited too long to send it back. It took a while to figure out what was wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn V.

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working ASAP. Literally 1 time use
customer_reviews.text: Second use and kept spilling water. Ruined my shirt. Size is very convenient but quality was very bad. Do not buy
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Rowenta Compact Steam Iron
customer_reviews.text: The third time I used this product it overheated, burned a hole through a iron board (Steady Betty) and then quit working completely. The first few times I used it I was very pleased so don't know if this was a fluke or something one should worry about. I was just glad I was at the ironing board when it happened or I don't know what would have happened.
customer_reviews.author: Judy

product_meta.title: Rowenta DA1560 Travel-Ready 1000-Watt Compact Steam Iron Stainless Steel Soleplate 120-Volt and 240-Volt, 200-Hole, Purple
product_meta.description: The DA1560 is a compact iron with all the benefits of a full sized Rowenta. Powerful steam is generated at a constant rate for optimal efficiency with a burst of steam button to remove tough wrinkles. The microsteam stainless steel soleplate has a precision tip for reaching narrow edges, seams and collars. The compact iron has a full range thermostat for use on all fabric types, and vertical steam capability to remove wrinkles in hanging garments. A transparent tank holds over 2-ounce of regular tap water, and the handle folds flat for storage. Ideal for travel, a dual voltage switch ensures that the iron is powerful at 120 or 230-volt. Travel pouch included.
feature_bullets: 1000-watt iron with micro steam stainless-steel soleplate
Adjustable temperature; consistent steam; burst-of-steam button
Vertical-steam option; 2-ounce transparent water tank; dual-voltage switch
Compact size; handle folds flat for storage; travel pouch included

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
